div.bibl: Narod Polski, Vol.10. No.25. June 20, 1906. Polish Community Orphanage

body.p: Last Sunday a meeting of representatives of parishes and organizations was held in Walsh's hall to decide on a way to promote the project by the "Federation of Polish Catholics" to build a large orphanage in Chicago.
An institution of this kind is very badly needed, and with pleasure we are informing our readers that the results were successful and make sure the realization of this project.
The plan is to purchase about 300 acres of land in the suburb of the city of Chicago, in Cook County, and then build a suitable building.
The amount of this sum should be collected among parishes and organizations in Chicago.
Title of the ownership will be made to the Archbishop of this archdiocese.
The members of the newly formed committee are: Archbishop Quigley, Rev.Lange, Gronkowski, Vojtalewicz, Zwierzchowski, Sztuczko and Czerwinski, also Messrs. Szopinski, Polenc and N.L.Piotorwski.
